title: Mark Geyer’s SuperCoach team
text:
Mark Geyer’s NRL SuperCoach team revealed Mark Geyer, The Daily Telegraph February 26, 2017 3:26pm 
I WISH SuperCoach was around when I was playing. 
It would have been great to see how I stacked up statistically against other players. 
They’ll never admit it, but I’m sure today’s players are always talking about SuperCoach and bantering about their stats. 
I’ve been into SuperCoach for a few years now and after taking down Tom Sangster in our head-to-head last season, MG’s Marvels are up for another massive year. 
I’m pretty happy to have four Panthers in my side, as well as a former Panther in Robert Jennings. media_camera Mark Geyer has four Panthers in his SuperCoach side including Bryce Cartwright and Tyrone Peachey. 
HOOKER 
Great workrate. Also plays back row and will play 80 minutes. 
Nathaniel Roache ($143,600) 
A Panthers favourite with an awesome workrate and plenty of offloads. 
Jesse Bromwich ($463,700) 
His stats speak for themselves. Won’t play Origin. 
Sam Tagataese ($188,500) 
Makes the Cronulla 17 every week and very cheap at $188,500. 
Patrick Kaufusi ($152,100) 
There are forward minutes up for grabs at the Cowboys and he will be valuable over Origin when Matt Scott is out. media_camera Tyrone Peachey is a key player for MG’s Marvels. 
BACK ROW 
I didn’t own him from the start last year and paid the price. 
Bryce Cartwright ($497,200) 
A SuperCoach gun whether he’s at lock, right edge or five-eighth. And he’s a Panther. 
Tyrone Peachey ($387,700) 
Plays every position but will start at centre, where he had a great season last year. 
Sia Soliola ($326,400) 
One of the unsung heroes of Canberra’s pack. 
Tony Williams ($263,200) 
Now at the Sharks and looking for redemption - and what better way to do it than in my SuperCoach side? 
Nat Butcher ($160,400) 
Starts cheap. Young gun coming through the grades at the Roosters. 
HALFBACK 
Shaun Johnson ($464,300) 
In for a big year. Has to perform if the Warriors are to make the eight and will form a great combination with Roger Tuivasa-Sheck. 
Ata Hingano ($165,400) 
Has the five-eighth spot locked in until Kieran Foran returns. 
FIVE-EIGHTH 
Cody Walker ($444,900) 
One of my great success stories from last year. I even picked him captain a few times and he was great in the Charity Shield. 
Jarryd Hayne ($244,700) 
At the price, it would be silly not to. 
CENTRE/WING 
Had him for most of last year and he scored big even when injured. 
Dean Whare ($143,600) 
Will start the year in the Penrith backline. Very cheap for an international centre. 
Kalyn Ponga ($122,600) 
It’s a gamble because he may not start the year but Ponga is in for a breakout season. 
Braidon Burns ($122,600) 
Great in the Charity Shield. 
Robert Jennings ($143,600) 
Brother of Michael Jennings. Hoping he scores a backline spot at the Rabbitohs. 
Brian Kelly ($122,600) 
Electric runner who is gunning for a backline spot at the Sea Eagles. 
Nick Cotric ($122,600) 
Heard only good things about this youngster and the exit of Edrick Lee opens to door. 
FULLBACK 
I’m backing RTS and Johnson to form an electric combo this year. 
Matt Dufty ($122,600)
